    </section>
    <section class="padding-bottom-20 bg-striped ">
        
        
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-39/part-34.html">
                                    Part I

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-39/part-34.html">


                                    PRELIMINARY

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Short title

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	1.  This Act may be called the <a title='Court of Wards Act, 1879' href='/act-39.html'>Court of Wards Act, 1879</a>:

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
   	Extent

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	It extends to the whole of  <span class='footnote'  title='The word "Bangladesh" was substituted, for the words "East Pakistan" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >2</a></sup></span></span>[Bangladesh].

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    2. [Omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Interpretation

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    3. In this Act, unless there be something repugnant in the subject or context,-		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"Civil Court" includes the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "High Court Division" were substituted, for the words "High Court of East Pakistan" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >3</a></sup></span></span>[High Court Division] in the exercise of its  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "ordinary and" were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >4</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] extraordinary original civil jurisdiction or its civil appellate or revisional jurisdiction;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"Collector" includes a Deputy Commissioner and any officer in-charge of the revenue-jurisdiction of a district;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	"the Court" means the Court of Wards;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>or, when the Court of Wards has delegated any of its powers to a  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "Commissioner or" were omitted by Article 4 and Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Repealing and Amending) Order, 1973 (President's Order No. 12 of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >5</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "Commissioner or Collector" were substituted, for the word "Collector" by section 2 and Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Amending) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. IX of 1976)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >6</a></sup></span></span>[Commissioner or Collector] or any other person, it means, in respect of such powers, the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "Commissioner or" were omitted by Article 4 and Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Repealing and Amending) Order, 1973 (President's Order No. 12 of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='5' >7</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "Commissioner or Collector" were substituted, for the word "Collector" by section 2 and Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Amending) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. IX of 1976)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='6' >8</a></sup></span></span>[Commissioner or Collector] or person to whom they are delegated:		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"estate" means all lands which are borne on the revenue-roll of a Collector as liable for the payment of one and the same demand of land-revenue and includes a share in or of an estate other than an undivided share held in coparcenary as the property of a Hindu joint family governed by the Mitakshara or Mithila law:		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"minor" means a person who has not completed his age of  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "eighteen years" were substituted, for the words "twenty-one years" by section 2 of the Court of Wards (Amendment) Act, 2006 (Act No. II of 2006)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='7' >9</a></sup></span></span>[eighteen years]:		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	"section" means a section of this Act:		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>"ward" means any person who is under the charge of the Court of Wards, or whose property is under such charge.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    4. [Omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-39/part-35.html">
                                    Part II

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-39/part-35.html">


                                    CONSTITUTION, JURISDICTION AND POWERS OF THE COURT OF WARDS

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Constitution and general duties of Court of Wards 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    5. The  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "Board of Land Administration" were substituted, for the word "Government" by section 4 and Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Amendment) Ordinance, 1982 (Ordinance No. XLI of 1982)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >10</a></sup></span></span>[Board of Land Administration] shall be the Court of Wards for the territories to which this Act extends.      It shall deal with every person and every property of which it may take or retain charge under this Act, or which may be placed under its charge by order of a competent Court, in accordance with the provisions of this Act.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Disqualified proprietors 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	6. Proprietors of estates shall be held disqualified to manage their own property when they are-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	females declared by the Court incompetent to manage their own property;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	persons declared by the Court to be minors;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	persons adjudged by a competent Civil Court to be of unsound mind, and incapable of managing their affairs;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	persons adjudged by a competent Civil Court to be otherwise rendered incapable by physical defects or infirmities of managing their own property;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	persons as to whom the Court has declared that they are disqualified, and that it is expedient in the public interest that their estates should be managed by the Court.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Jurisdiction of Court over disqualified proprietors 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	7.  Whenever the sole proprietor of an estate, or all the joint proprietors of an estate are disqualified as provided in the last preceding section, the Court shall have power to take charge of all the property of every such proprietor or joint proprietor within its jurisdiction, and of the person of any such proprietor or joint proprietor who is resident within its jurisdiction; and also of the person and property of any minor member of the family of any such proprietor or joint proprietor who has an immediate or reversionary interest in the property of such proprietor or joint proprietor:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Provided that the Court shall not be empowered to take charge of the person of a proprietor disqualified under clause (e) of section 6.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Court when bound to give up charge 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	8. Whenever the circumstances of any ward become such that the Court could not take charge of him or of his property if he were not under its charge already, the Court shall be bound to release from its charge such person and his property.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Charge of Court in case of acquisition under E. B. Act XXVIII of 1951 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	 <span class='footnote'  title='Section 8A was inserted by section 2 of the East Bengal Court of Wards (Amendment) Act, 1952 (Act No. X of 1952)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >11</a></sup></span></span>[8A. If the rent-receiving interests of a ward in any estate under the charge of the Court are acquired under the provisions of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "East Bengal" were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >12</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] State Acquisition and Tenancy Act, 1950, then, notwithstanding anything contained elsewhere in this Act, the remaining properties of such ward including khas lands under the charge of the Court shall continue to remain under its charge and shall be managed in accordance with the provisions of this Act, as if such ward were a disqualified proprietor of an estate.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Explanation - In this section khas land has the same meaning as in clause (15) of section 2 of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words "East Bengal" were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >13</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] State  Acquisition and Tenancy Act, 1950.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Discretion of Court as to taking and keeping charge 

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	9. The Court may in its discretion, in any case in which it is empowered by this Act to take charge of the person and property of any disqualified proprietor,-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	take charge of such property without taking charge of such person;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	refrain from taking charge of any such person or property;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	at any time withdraw from such charge, if taken;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	at any time resume such charge, after having withdrawn from it.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Effect of withdrawal from charge

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	 <span class='footnote'  title='Section 9A was inserted by section 2 of the Bengal Court of Wards (Amendment) Act, 1935 (Act No. I of 1935)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >14</a></sup></span></span>[9A. When the Court of Wards withdraws from the charge of such property it shall publish, in the manner provided in section  64A, a notice of the termination of the charge and thereupon subject to the provisions of clause 3 of section 23-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	such charge shall terminate with effect from the date fixed in accordance with the provisions of section 65;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	the owner of the said property shall be restored to the possession thereof from the said date subject to any order made by a Civil Court and to any contracts entered into by the Court of Wards for the preservation or benefit of such property.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
